html:
EQUITIES: Markets on Course for Lower Weekly Close Despite Friday Rally
* Following an acutely volatile beginning to the week, the S&P 500 looked to
  confirm a fourth consecutive week of losses, with the busy earnings calendar,
  heightened geopolitical risk and a hawkish Federal Reserve meeting conspiring
  against prices. Despite a solid session on Friday, with tech names (and
  notably the NASDAQ) rallying, markets were unable to climb above last
  Friday's close, leaving indices lower for fourth consecutive week.
* Friday's recovery was led by the likes of Apple, Visa and Mastercard, who all
  rallied 5% on more on a solid set of earnings, helping the tech sector to the
  top of the S&P 500.
* Energy names were the laggard despite still-buoyant crude prices as Chevron's
  earnings missed forecast - with profits and revenues failing to keep up with
  oil price rally.
* Earnings season continues in the coming week, with a further 28% of the
  S&P500 due to report, including megacap names Meta (Facebook), Amazon and
  Alphabet. Full schedule as well as EPS and Revenue expectations here:
  https://roar-assets-auto.rbl.ms/documents/13665/MN...:
  https://roar-assets-auto.rbl.ms/documents/13665/MNIUSEARNINGS310122.pdf
